thread.title: Boris had a brick, but George has the master plan
thread.title_full: Boris had a brick, but George has the master plan

title: Boris had a brick, but George has the master plan
text:
Boris had a brick, but George has the master plan The chancellor said that the next five years would be about building on the success of his previous measures Paul Ellis/AFP Google+ 1 of 1 The chancellor said that the next five years would be about building on the success of his previous measures Paul Ellis/AFP Patrick Kidd Published 23 minutes ago 
George Osborne strode on to the stage wearing an enormously smug grin — truly, he understands the needs of hard-smirking people — but he was not here in his role as chancellor of the exchequer. Mr Osborne has a much higher destiny than that. This was the entry of the Master Builder. 
  why, except that it was the sort of thing that Boris tends to do, usually so that he can make a rude joke about the French. One brick is not
